(2)  On the east side of Eberly Avenue between 47th Street on the south and Ogden Avenue on the north. 
(3)  On Plainfield Road between 47th Street on the south and Custer Avenue on the north. 
(Code 1964, § 18-65(c); Ord. of 5-13-1963, § 1; Ord. of 8-8-1966, § 1; Ord. No. 1972-25, § 1, 7-31-1972; Ord. No. 1972-29, § 1, 8-28-1972; Ord. No. 1984-37, 12-10-1984; Ord. No. 1986-9, 3-24-1986; Ord. No. 1986-23, 10-23-1986; Ord. No. 93-48, 9-27-1993)  
Sec. 54-516. - Forty mile per hour streets. 
No person shall drive any vehicle of whatever description more than 40 miles per hour on any of the following streets in the village, said streets being in an urban district as defined by state statutes: On the north side of 47th Street between Eberly Avenue on the west and Custer Avenue on the east. 
(Code 1964, § 18-65(d); Ord. of 5-13-1963, § 1; Ord. of 8-8-1966, § 1; Ord. No. 1972-25, § 1, 7-31-1972; Ord. No. 1972-29, § 1, 8-28-1972; Ord. No. 1984-37, 12-10-1984; Ord. No. 1986-9, 3-24-1986; Ord. No. 1986-23, 10-23-1986; Ord. No. 93-48, 9-27-1993)  
Secs. 54-517—54-519. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 3. - SCHOOL ZONES 
 
Sec. 54-520. - Special speed limit while passing schools. 
(a)  Hollywood Avenue from Washington Avenue to Rockefeller Avenue is hereby designated a school zone. 
(b)  On a school day when schoolchildren are present and so close thereto that a potential hazard exists because of the close proximity of the motorized traffic, no person shall drive a motor vehicle at a speed in excess of 20 miles per hour while passing through a school zone or while traveling upon any public thoroughfare where children pass going to and from school. 
(c)  For the purpose of this section a school day shall begin at seven ante meridian (a.m.) and shall conclude at four post meridian (p.m.). 
(d)  This section shall not be applicable unless appropriate signs are posted upon the streets wherein the school zone is located. With regard to the special speed limit while passing schools, the signs shall give proper due warning that a school zone is being approached and shall indicate the school zone and the maximum speed limit in effect during school days when school children are present. 
(e)  Except as provided in subsection (f), a person who violates this section is guilty of a petty offense. Violations of this section are punishable with a minimum fine of $150.00 for the first violation and a minimum fine of $300.00 for the second or subsequent violation. 
(f)  A person committing a violation of this section is guilty of aggravated special speed limit while passing schools when he or she drives a motor vehicle at a speed that is: 
(1)  Twenty-six miles per hour or more but less than 35 miles per hour in excess of the applicable special speed limit established under this section is guilty of a class B misdemeanor; or 
(2)  Thirty-five miles per hour or more in excess of the applicable special speed limit established under this section is guilty of a class A misdemeanor. 
(g)  When a fine for a violation of subsection (b) is $150.00 or greater, the person who violates subsection (b) shall be charged an additional $50.00 to be paid to the school district where the violation occurred for school safety purposes. 
(h)  For purposes of subsection (g), "school safety purposes" includes the costs associated with school zone safety education, the Safe Routes to School Program under Section 2705-317 of the Department of Transportation Law of the Civil Administrative Code of Illinois, safety programs within the School Safety and Educational Improvement Block Grant Program under Section 2-3.51.5 of the Illinois School Code, and the purchase, installation, and maintenance of caution lights which are mounted on school speed zone signs. 
( Ord. No. 2015-62, § 3 , 9-28-2015)  
Secs. 54-521—54-540. - Reserved.  
ARTICLE VIII. - VEHICLE OPERATION RULES  
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 
 
Sec. 54-541. - Boarding or alighting from moving vehicles. 
No person shall board or alight from any vehicle while such vehicle is in motion. 
(Code 1940, § 35.058; Code 1964, § 18-5)  
Sec. 54-542. - Riding on portion of vehicle not intended for passengers. 
No person shall ride on any vehicle upon any portion thereof not designed or intended for the use of passengers. This provision shall not apply to an employee engaged in the necessary performance of his duty or to persons riding within truck bodies in space intended for merchandise. 
(Code 1940, § 35.057; Code 1964, § 18-6)  
Sec. 54-543. - Use of skates, coasters, etc., on roadway. 
No person upon roller skates or riding in or by means of any coaster, toy vehicle, or similar device shall go upon any roadway except while crossing a street on a crosswalk and except upon streets set aside as play streets when and as authorized in this chapter or by state law. 
(Code 1940, § 35.056; Code 1964, § 18-7)  
Sec. 54-544. - Riding on motorcycles. 
A person operating a motorcycle shall ride only upon the permanent and regular seat attached thereto, and such operator shall not carry any other person nor shall any other person ride on a motorcycle unless such motorcycle is designed to carry more than one person, in which event a passenger may ride upon the permanent and regular seat if designed for two persons, or upon another seat firmly attached to the rear or side of the operator. 
(Code 1964, § 18-8)  
Sec. 54-545. - Passengers not to interfere with driver's view or control. 
No person shall drive a vehicle when it is so loaded, or when there are in the front seat such number of persons, exceeding three, as to obstruct the view of the driver to the front or sides of the vehicle or as to interfere with the driver's control over the driving mechanism of the vehicle. No passenger in a vehicle shall ride in such position as to interfere with the driver's view ahead or to the sides, or to interfere with his control over the driving mechanism of the vehicle. 
(Code 1964, § 18-9)  
Sec. 54-546. - Obstructing traffic prohibited. 
No vehicle shall be operated or allowed to remain upon any street in such a manner as to form an unreasonable obstruction to traffic thereon. 
(Code 1940, § 35.060; Code 1964, § 18-6)  
Secs. 54-547—54-570. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 2. - DRIVING AND PASSING 
 
Sec. 54-571. - Improper operation of a motor vehicle. 
No person shall operate a motor vehicle upon any public street, alley or highway in the village: 
(1)  At a rate of speed or in any manner that is unreasonable or imprudent having regard to the traffic and use of the way, condition of weather, visibility, condition of the roadway and other surrounding conditions, so as to endanger the life or limb or injure the property of any other person. 
(2)  In such a manner as to deprive or unreasonably interfere with the equal rights of any other person to the use of such public street or highway. 
(3)  In such a manner as to cause or produce unnecessary loud, raucous, excessive or unusual noise by racing the motor, by lack of a muffler or use of a muffler cutout, by tire friction upon rapid turning or weaving, by spinning of the wheels from standing or slow moving position produced by sudden unnecessary motor acceleration, or by continuous unnecessary sounding of a horn or other signal device. 
(4)  In disregard of any sign, signal, marking or device erected, constructed or created by the village or any public body or official having jurisdiction, for the purpose of regulating, warning or guiding traffic, or contrary to the order or direction of any police officer or other person duly authorized to direct or regulate traffic. 
(Code 1964, § 18-92; Ord. of 5-24-1965, § 1)  
Sec. 54-572. - Duty to drive on right side of roadway. 
(a)  Upon all roadways of sufficient width, a vehicle shall be driven upon the right half of the roadway, except as follows: 
(1)  When overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction under the rules governing such movement; 
(2)  When the right half of the roadway is closed to traffic while under construction or repair; 
(3)  Upon a roadway divided into three marked lanes for traffic under the rules applicable thereon; or 
(4)  Upon a roadway designated and sign posted for one-way traffic. 
(b)  Upon all roadways, any vehicle proceeding at less than the normal speed of traffic at the time and place and under the conditions then existing shall be driven in the right-hand lane available for traffic, or as close as practicable to the right-hand curb or edge of the roadway, except when overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction or when preparing for a left turn at an intersection or into a private road or driveway. 
(Code 1964, § 18-61)  
Sec. 54-573. - Driving on roadways laned for traffic. 
Whenever any roadway has been divided into three or more clearly marked lanes for traffic the following rules, in addition to all others consistent herewith, shall apply: 
(1)  A vehicle shall be driven as nearly as practical entirely within a single lane and shall not be moved from such lane until the driver has first ascertained that such movement can be made with safety. 
(2)  Upon a roadway which is divided into three lanes, a vehicle shall not be driven in the center lane except when overtaking and passing another vehicle where the roadway is clearly visible and such center lane is clear of traffic within a safe distance, or in preparation for a left turn, or where such center lane is, at the time, allocated exclusively to traffic moving in the direction the vehicle is proceeding and is signposted to give notice of such allocation. 
(3)  Official signs may be erected directing slow moving traffic to use a designated lane or allocating specified lanes to traffic moving in the same direction and drivers of vehicle shall obey every such sign. 
(4)  Reversible lanes on streets and highways may be designated for all times or only during certain specified periods of time upon the erection of lane-control signals or official signs to effect the allocated lane usage. Drivers of vehicles shall obey the directions of every such sign and signal. 
(Code 1964, § 18-81)  
Sec. 54-574. - Right-of-way at intersections. 
(a)  The driver of a vehicle approaching an intersection shall yield the right-of way to a vehicle which has entered the intersection from a different street. 
(b)  When two vehicles enter an intersection from different streets at approximately the same time, the driver of the vehicle on the left shall yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on the right. 
(c)  The right-of-way rules declared in this section shall not apply at through streets and at other locations governed by specific provisions of this division. 
(d)  The driver of a vehicle within an intersection intending to turn to the left shall yield the right-of-way to any vehicle approaching from the opposite direction which is within the intersection or so close thereto as to constitute an immediate hazard, but such driver, having so yielded and having given a signal when and as required by this division, may make such left turn and the drivers of all vehicles approaching the intersection from the opposite direction shall yield the right-of-way to the vehicle making the left turn. 
(Code 1964, § 18-74)  
Sec. 54-575. - Driving in wrong direction. 
When signs indicated the lawful direction of traffic are in place, it shall be unlawful for any person to drive any vehicle on such streets in any but the indicated lawful direction. 
(Code 1940, § 35.036; Code 1964, § 18-72)  
Sec. 54-576. - Driving on closed streets. 
No driver of any vehicle, except an authorized emergency vehicle while engaged in emergency duty, shall drive such vehicle upon any street or highway which is officially closed to traffic and which is plainly indicated as such by officially erected signs, barricades, or other traffic-control devices. 
(Code 1940, § 35.054; Code 1964, § 18-82)  
Sec. 54-577. - Driving on sidewalks or over parkways or curbing. 
No driver of a vehicle shall drive within any sidewalk area or over any parkway or curbing, except at a permanent or temporary driveway. 
(Code 1940, §§ 25.149, 35.053; Code 1964, § 18-83)  
Sec. 54-578. - Driving on play streets. 
Whenever authorized signs are erected indicating any street or part thereof as a play street, no person shall drive a vehicle upon any street or portion thereof except drivers of vehicles having business or whose residences are within such closed area, and then any such driver shall exercise the greatest care in driving upon such street or portion thereof. 
(Code 1940, § 35.041; Code 1964, § 18-84)  
Sec. 54-579. - Driving through safety zone. 
No vehicle shall at any time be driven through a safety zone. 
(Code 1940, § 35.013; Code 1964, § 18-85)  
Sec. 54-580. - Following too closely. 
The driver of a motor vehicle shall not follow another vehicle more closely than is reasonable and prudent, having due regard for the speed of such vehicles and the traffic upon and condition of the street. 
(Code 1964, § 18-89)  
Sec. 54-581. - Following fire apparatus. 
It shall be unlawful for the operator of any vehicle, other than one on official business, to follow any fire apparatus in response to an alarm closer than one block. 
(Code 1940, § 35.043; Code 1964, § 18-90)  
Sec. 54-582. - Driving over fire hose. 
It shall be unlawful for the operator of any vehicle to drive over any unprotected hose of the fire division without the consent of the fire chief or the assistant in command. 
(Code 1940, §§ 20.014, 35.044; Code 1964, § 18-91)  
Sec. 54-583. - Procedure upon approach of authorized emergency vehicle. 
(a)  Upon the immediate approach of an authorized emergency vehicle, when the driver is giving audible signal by siren, exhaust whistle, or bell, the driver of every other vehicle shall yield the right-of-way and shall immediately drive to a position parallel to, and as close as possible to, the right-hand edge or curb of the street, clear of any intersection, and shall stop and remain in such position until the authorized emergency vehicle has passed, except as otherwise directed by a police officer. 
(b)  This section shall not operate to relieve the driver of an authorized emergency vehicle from the duty to drive with due regard for the safety of all persons using the street. 
(Code 1940, § 35.042; Code 1964, § 18-70)  
Sec. 54-584. - Driving while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or drugs. 
It shall be unlawful for any person who is a habitual user of narcotic drugs or any person who is under the influence of intoxicating liquor or narcotic drugs to drive any vehicle within the village. 
(Code 1940, § 35.045; Code 1964, § 18-68)  
Sec. 54-585. - Limitations on backing. 
The driver of a vehicle shall not back the same into an intersection or over a crosswalk and shall not, in any event or at any place, back a vehicle unless such movement can be made with reasonable safety and without interfering with other traffic. 
(Code 1940, § 35.052; Code 1964, § 18-80)  
Sec. 54-586. - Reckless driving. 
Any person who drives any vehicle with a willful or a wanton disregard for the safety of persons or property shall be guilty of reckless driving and a violation of this division. 
(Code 1940, § 35.046; Code 1964, § 18-69)  
Sec. 54-587. - Passing vehicle proceeding in opposite direction. 
Drivers of vehicles proceeding in opposite directions, except as otherwise specifically provided in this division, shall pass each other to the right and, upon roadways having width for not more than one line of traffic in each direction, each driver shall give to the other at least one-half of the main traveled portion of the roadway as nearly as possible. 
(Code 1964, § 18-62)  
Sec. 54-588. - Passing vehicle proceeding in same direction. 
(a)  The driver of a vehicle overtaking another vehicle proceeding in the same direction shall pass to the left thereof at a safe distance and shall not again drive to the right side of the roadway until safely clear of the overtaken vehicle. 
(b)  Except when overtaking and passing on the right is permitted, the driver of an overtaken vehicle shall give way to the right in favor of the overtaking vehicle on audible signal and shall not increase the speed of his vehicle until completely passed by the overtaking vehicle. 
(c)  The driver of a vehicle may overtake and pass upon the right of another vehicle which is making or about to make a left turn. 
(d)  The driver of a vehicle may overtake and, allowing sufficient clearance, pass another vehicle proceeding in the same direction either upon the left or upon the right on a roadway with unobstructed pavement of sufficient width for four or more lines of moving traffic, when such movement can be made in safety. No person shall drive off the pavement or upon the shoulder of the roadway in overtaking or passing on the right. 
(e)  The driver of a vehicle may overtake and pass another vehicle upon the right upon a one-way street, or upon any roadway on which traffic is restricted to one direction of movement, where the roadway is free from obstructions and of sufficient width for two or more lanes of moving vehicles. 
(f)  No vehicle shall be driven to the left side of the center of the roadway in overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction unless such left side is clearly visible and is free of oncoming traffic for a sufficient distance ahead to permit such overtaking and passing to be completely made without interfering with the safe operation of any vehicle approaching from the opposite direction or any vehicle overtaken. In every event, the overtaking vehicle must return to the right-hand side of the roadway before coming within 100 feet of any vehicle approaching from the opposite direction. 
(g)  No vehicle shall, in overtaking and passing another vehicle or at any other time, be driven to the left side of the roadway under the following conditions: 
(1)  When approaching the crest of a grade or upon a curve in the street where the driver's view is obstructed within such distance as to create a hazard in the event another vehicle might approach from the opposite direction. 
(2)  When approaching within 100 feet of or traversing any intersection of railroad grade crossing. 
(3)  Where official signs are in place directing that traffic keep to the right, or a distinctive centerline is marked, which distinctive line also directs traffic as declared in the sign manual adopted by the state department of public works and buildings. 
(h)  The limitations in subsection (g)(1) and (g)(2) of this section shall not apply upon a one-way or upon a roadway with unobstructed pavement of sufficient width for two or more lanes of moving traffic in each direction when such movement can be made with safety. 
(Code 1964, § 18-63)  
Sec. 54-589. - Duty to stop. 
Every driver of a vehicle approaching a stop sign shall bring such vehicle to a complete stop before entering the crosswalk on the near side of the intersection or, in the event there is no crosswalk, at a clearly marked stop line, but, if none, then at the point nearest the intersecting street where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting street, before entering the intersection, and allow vehicular traffic traveling on such through street to proceed before crossing or entering in or upon such through street, except when directed to proceed by a police officer or traffic-control signal. 
(Code 1940, §§ 35.014, 35.034; Code 1964, § 18-117)  
Sec. 54-590. - Stop required upon emerging from alley, driveway or building. 
The driver of a vehicle emerging from an alley, driveway, or building shall stop such vehicle immediately prior to driving onto a sidewalk or into the sidewalk area extending across any alleyway or private driveway, and shall yield the right-of-way to any pedestrian as may be necessary to avoid collision, and upon entering the roadway, shall yield the right-of-way to all vehicles approaching on such roadway. 
(Code 1940, § 35.015; Code 1964, § 18-118)  
Secs. 54-591—54-613. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 3. - TURNING 
 
Sec. 54-614. - Turning restrictions generally. 
The director of public works and services shall place proper official signs, as directed by the board of trustees, at intersections or other places at which drivers of vehicles shall not make a right, left or U-turn. He shall also place official markers, buttons or signs, as directed by the board of trustees, within or adjacent to intersections indicating the course to be traveled by vehicles turning at such intersections, and such course to be traveled as so indicated may conform to or be other than so prescribed by law or ordinance. Whenever such authorized signs are erected, no driver of a vehicle shall disobey the directions of any such sign. 
(Code 1940, §§ 35.036, 35.039; Code 1964, § 18-75)  
Sec. 54-615. - Method of turning at intersections. 
The driver of a vehicle intending to turn at an intersection shall do so as follows: 
(1)  The approach for both a right turn and a left turn shall be made as close as practical to the right-hand curb or edge of the roadway. 
(2)  At any intersection where traffic is permitted to move in both directions on each roadway entering the intersection, an approach for a left turn shall be made in that portion of the right half of the roadway nearest the centerline thereof and by passing to the right of such centerline where it enters the intersection and after entering the intersection the left turn shall be made so as to leave the intersection to the right of the centerline of the roadway being entered. Whenever practicable, the left turn shall be made in that portion of the intersection to the left of the center of the intersection. 
(3)  At any intersection where traffic is restricted to one direction on one or more of the roadways, the driver of a vehicle intending to turn left at any such intersection shall approach the intersection in the extreme left-hand lane lawfully available to traffic moving in the direction of such vehicle and, after entering the intersection, as nearly as practicable, in the left-hand lane lawfully available to traffic moving in such direction upon the roadway being entered. 
(Code 1964, § 18-76)  
Sec. 54-616. - U-turns prohibited on Grand Boulevard. 
No person driving a motor vehicle in either direction upon Grand Boulevard between its intersection with Brookfield Avenue and Grant Avenue shall cross the double line dividing the two lanes of traffic or turn in any manner for the purpose of changing direction of travel or to park on the opposite side of the street from which the vehicle is traveling. 
(Code 1940, § 35.031; Code 1964, § 18-77; Ord. of 8-29-1966, § 1)  
Sec. 54-617. - Turns prohibited. 
Turns are prohibited as follows: 
(1)  No right turn on red on Prairie Avenue and Ogden Avenue, northwest corner. 
(2)  No left turn from southbound Maple Avenue onto eastbound Burlington Avenue. 
(3)  No right turn on red from northbound Maple Avenue onto eastbound 31st Street on school days when children are present. 
(4)  No right turn on red on southbound Maple Avenue at Ogden Avenue. 
(5)  No right turn on red when pedestrians are present on northbound Maple Avenue at Ogden Avenue and on eastbound and westbound Ogden Avenue at Maple Avenue. 
(6)  No left turn on northbound Hollywood Avenue to westbound Washington Avenue on school days when school children are present between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. 
(7)  No right turn on eastbound Rockefeller to southbound Hollywood Avenue on school days when school children are present between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. 
(Code 1964, § 18-78; Ord. No. 1975-4, § 1, 2-24-1975; Ord. No. 1977-19, § 1, 6-13-1977; Ord. No. 1983-32, 11-28-1983; Ord. No. 1987-3, 2-9-1987; Ord. No. 2009-48, § 2, 9-14-2009; Ord. No. 2015-62, § 4 , 9-28-2015)  
Secs. 54-618—54-637. - Reserved.  
ARTICLE IX. - STOPPING, STANDING AND PARKING  
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 
 
Sec. 54-638. - Article does not affect other licensing provisions. 
Nothing contained in this article shall be construed as in any manner repealing or modifying any other provisions of this Code or other ordinances of the village relating to any particular business licensed by the village, wherein vehicles are used upon the streets, avenues and alleys of the village nor shall it affect the vehicle licensing provisions of this chapter. 
(Code 1964, § 18-221; Ord. No. 1986-4, 1-13-1986; Ord. No. 1990-4, 1-22-1990)  
Sec. 54-639. - Leaving unattended vehicle. 
(a)  No person driving or in charge of a motor vehicle shall permit it to stand unattended in any public place or on any used or new car lot, or parking lot without first stopping the engine, locking the ignition, removing the ignition key from the vehicle, effectively setting the brake thereon, and when standing upon any grade, turning the front wheels to the curb or side of the highway. 
(b)  Whenever any police officer shall find a motor vehicle standing unattended with the ignition key in the vehicle, in violation of this article, such police officer is authorized to remove such key from such vehicle and to deliver such key to the police officer in charge of the nearest police station. 
(c)  The registered owner of a vehicle found in violation of this section shall be held prima facie responsible for any such violation. 
(Code 1964, §§ 18-92, 18-94, 18-1995; Ord. of 10-23-1967, § 1)  
Sec. 54-640. - Starting vehicle which is stopped, standing or parked. 
No person shall start a vehicle which is stopped, standing, or parked unless and until such movement can be made with reasonable safety. 
(Code 1964, § 18-131)  
Sec. 54-641. - Unauthorized moving or tampering with parked vehicle. 
No person other than the village manager or police chief or a person authorized by the village manager or police chief shall move a vehicle into any area where parking is prohibited or away from a curb such distance as is unlawful or start or cause to be started the motor of any motor vehicle, or shift, change, or move the levers, brake, starting device, gears, or other mechanism of a standing motor vehicle to a position other than that in which it was left by the owner or driver thereof, or attempt to do so. 
(Code 1964, § 18-132; Ord. of 6-24-1957, § 1)  
Sec. 54-642. - Prohibited or limited parking areas to be marked or signed. 
Except as otherwise specifically provided in this division, all areas in the village in which the parking of vehicles is prohibited or limited shall be designated by painting the curb a distinctive color or by curb markings or signs which clearly indicate the prohibition or limitation. It shall be the duty of the department of public works and services to mark such curbs or erect such signs, as from time to time directed by the board of trustees. 
(Code 1940, §§ 35.020, 35.021, 35.036; Code 1964, § 18-130)  
Sec. 54-643. - Prohibition of parking on narrow streets. 
The director of public works and services, as directed by the village manager, shall have the power to erect signs indicating "no parking" upon any street when the width of the roadway does not exceed 20 feet or upon one side of a street, as indicated by such signs, when the width of the roadway does not exceed 30 feet, and it shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle in violation of such signs. 
(Code 1940, § 35.036; Code 1964, § 18-126)  
Sec. 54-644. - Alleys. 
No person shall park a vehicle within an alley in such a manner or under such conditions as to leave available less than ten feet of the roadway for the free movement of vehicular traffic, and no person shall stop, stand, or park a vehicle at any time in such a manner or position as to block the driveway entrance or garage of another. 
(Code 1940, §§ 35.017, 35.027; Code 1964, § 18-112; Ord. of 9-28-1953, § 1; Ord. of 2-8-1954, § 1; Ord. of 9-28-1959, § 1; Ord. No. 1968-21, § 1, 7-8-1968; Ord. No. 1971-19, § 1, 9-11-1971; Ord. No. 1988-28, 9-26-1988)  
Sec. 54-645. - Village resident parking only; authorization. 
(a)  No person shall park any vehicle at any time in those areas where such signs are posted, except persons who are actual residents of the village owning motor vehicles bearing valid vehicle license tags issued by the village, or their authorized guests. 
(b)  Authorization to park motor vehicles not bearing valid vehicle license tags issued by the village shall be received from the desk officer on duty at the village police department by supplying the information, either in person or by telephone, as to the location of the motor vehicle by street address and the state license plate number of the vehicle. 
(c)  Authorization must be received for each day the motor vehicle is to be located within the village limits and the daily authorization shall not exceed 14 in number for each vehicle for which authorization is issued. 
(Code 1940, § 35.036; Code 1964, § 18-98(11); Ord. No. 1978-30, § A, 8-14-1978; Ord. No. 1978-36, § A, 8-28-1978; Ord. No. 1979-76, 11-12-1979)  
Sec. 54-646. - Prohibited for certain purposes. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to stop, stand or park any vehicle upon any street in the village for: 
(1)  The principal purpose of displaying such vehicle for sale; 
(2)  The purpose of washing, greasing, or repairing such vehicle, except repairs necessitated by an emergency; or 
(3)  The primary purpose of advertising. 
(Code 1940, §§ 25.085, 35.024—35.026; Code 1964, § 18-114)  
Sec. 54-647. - Prohibited in certain places generally. 
No person shall stop, stand, or park a vehicle, except when necessary to avoid a conflict with other traffic or in compliance with the direction of a police officer or traffic-control device in any of the following places: 
(1)  On a sidewalk. 
(2)  In front of a public or private driveway, alley or garage. 
(3)  Within an intersection. 
(4)  Within 15 feet of a fire hydrant, measured parallel to the curbline in both directions. 
(5)  On a crosswalk. 
(6)  Within 20 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection. 
(7)  Within 30 feet upon the approach to any flashing beacon, stop sign, or traffic-control signal located at the side of a roadway. 
(8)  Within 50 feet of the nearest rail of a railroad grade crossing. 
(9)  Within 20 feet of the driveway entrance to any fire station and on the side of the street opposite the entrance to any fire station within 75 feet of such entrance when properly signposted. 
(10)  Alongside or opposite any street excavation or obstruction when such stopping, standing, or parking would obstruct traffic. 
(11)  On the roadway side of any vehicle stopped or parked at the edge or curb of a street. 
(12)  Upon any bridge or other elevated structure upon a highway or within a highway tunnel. 
(13)  At any place where official signs prohibit stopping. 
(14)  On any street in front or beside a gasoline filling station. 
(Code 1940, §§ 35.017, 35.027; Code 1964, § 18-112; Ord. of 9-28-1953, § 1; Ord. of 2-8-1954, § 1; Ord. of 9-28-1959, § 1; Ord. No. 1968-21, § 1, 7-8-1968; Ord. No. 1971-19, § 1, 9-11-1971; Ord. No. 1988-28, 9-26-1988; Ord. No. 2014-19, § 2, 3-24-2014 )  
Sec. 54-648. - Parking in park system areas. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle in any park in the village's park system except within designated parking lots or other areas specifically designated and signed for motor vehicle parking. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for any person to park a vehicle or to have a vehicle parked in any park within the village between sunset and sunrise. This provision shall not apply to officers or employees of the village while in discharge of their duties, nor to persons having a permit in writing to be or remain in any part of the park, issued by the village manager or the director of playground and recreation, nor to any village organized and sponsored recreation program. 
(c)  It shall also be unlawful for any person to park a vehicle or to have a vehicle parked in any park within the village at any time where such parking area is signed as being "Closed." 
(Code 1964, §§ 18-123.01, 18-123.02; Ord. No. 94-53, 12-12-1994)  
Sec. 54-649. - Parking prohibited in designated loading zones. 
It shall be unlawful for any unauthorized person to park any vehicle in an area designated as a loading zone at any of the following places in the village at the time herein specified: 
(1)  Prohibited at all times: 
a.  On the north side of 47th Street, beginning at a point 158 feet east of the intersection of Eberly Avenue and 47th Street; thence east for a distance of 25 feet. 
b.  On the east side of Park Avenue, beginning at a point 47 feet south of the intersection of Grant Avenue and Park Avenue; thence south a distance of 90 feet. 
c.  On the south side of Grant Avenue, beginning at a point 100 feet east of Park Avenue; thence east for a distance of 25 feet. 
d.  On the east side of Grove Avenue, beginning at a point 100 feet north of the intersection of Grove Avenue and 47th Street; thence north for a distance of 190 feet. 
(2)  Between 11 a.m. and 3 p.m., except Sundays and holidays: On the east side of Prairie Avenue beginning at a point 50 feet south of the intersection of Prairie Avenue and Burlington Avenue; thence south for a distance of 40 feet. 
(Code 1964, § 18-122; Ord. No. 1968-21, § 2, 7-8-1968; Ord. No. 1978-8, § 1, 4-24-1978; Ord. No. 1979-4, § A, 2-12-1979; Ord. No. 1989-15, 5-22-1989; Ord. No. 95-3, 1-23-1995)  
Sec. 54-650. - Parking in excess of 72 hours prohibited. 
Except where time regulations are more restrictive in this article, it shall be unlawful for any person to park in the same location, any vehicle on any street, alley, or public property in excess of 72 hours. 
(Code 1964, § 18-128(b); Ord. No. 78-51, § A, 11-27-1978; Ord. No. 79-55, 9-10-1979; Ord. No. 88-28, 9-26-1988; Ord. No. 90-34, 6-25-1990; Ord. No. 91-25, 7-22-1991; Ord. No. 98-49, 11-9-1998)  
Sec. 54-651. - Parking prohibited on posted residential property; exceptions. 
No person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle upon any property zoned for residential use, when proper signs have been posted at or near such property. This section shall not prohibit any person, or his guest, from parking a vehicle upon a portion of his own property which has been improved with a dwelling. 
(Code 1964, § 18-113; Ord. of 11-4-1957, § 1)  
Sec. 54-652. - Standing or parking of buses and taxicabs. 
(a)  The driver of a bus or taxicab shall not stand or park upon any street in any business district at any place other than at a bus stop or taxicab stand, respectively. This provision shall not prevent the driver of any vehicle from temporarily stopping in accordance with other stopping or parking regulations at any place for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading and unloading passengers. 
(b)  No person shall stop, stand, or park a vehicle, other than a bus, in a bus stop, or other than a taxicab in a taxicab stand, when any such stop or stand has been officially designated and appropriately signed, except that the driver of a passenger vehicle may temporarily stop therein for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading and unloading passengers when such stopping does not interfere with any bus or taxicab waiting to enter or about to enter such zone. 
(Code 1940, § 35.023; Code 1964, § 18-127)  
Sec. 54-653. - Recreational vehicles. 
It shall be unlawful for any person owning, controlling, driving or operating any camper trailer, pickup coach, motorized home, travel trailer, boat, boat/trailer combination, boat trailer, or any commonly referred to recreational vehicle, as defined within this division to park said recreational vehicle on any street, alley or other public property within the village; except that said recreational vehicles may be parked where not otherwise prohibited by this division on the street for the express purpose of loading or unloading for a period not to exceed 48 hours. 
(Code 1964, § 18-128(c); Ord. No. 78-51, § A, 11-27-1978; Ord. No. 79-55, 9-10-1979; Ord. No. 88-28, 9-26-1988; Ord. No. 90-34, 6-25-1990; Ord. No. 91-25, 7-22-1991; Ord. No. 98-49, 11-9-1998)  
Secs. 54-654—54-679. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 2. - ANGLE AND OTHER MARKED PARKING SPACES 
 
Sec. 54-680. - Manner of parking generally. 
Except where angle parking is permitted, as indicated by appropriate markings or signs, every vehicle stopped or parked upon a two-way roadway shall be so stopped or parked with the right-hand wheels parallel to and within 12 inches of the right-hand curb or as close as practicable to the right edge of the right-hand shoulder. 
(Code 1940, § 35.029; Code 1964, § 18-119; Ord. No. 1978-32, § A, 8-14-1978)  
Sec. 54-681. - Marking of streets upon which angle parking is permitted. 
The director of public works and services shall appropriately mark or sign streets upon which angle parking shall be permitted. 
(Code 1940, § 35.036; Code 1964, § 18-120)  
Sec. 54-682. - Parking within lines or markings required. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle upon or across any lines or markings designating, marking or setting off areas on the streets or highways of the village as parking areas, made under the authority of the department of public works and services or other public authority of the village pursuant to any ordinance of the village or as directed by the board of trustees, but all vehicles parked within such parking areas shall be parked wholly within such parking areas and completely within such lines or markings. 
(Code 1964, § 18-121; Ord. of 7-13-1954, § 1)  
Secs. 54-683—54-707. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 3. - PARKING FOR DISABLED PERSONS  
Subdivision I. - In General 
 
Sec. 54-708. - Parking in spaces reserved for persons with disabilities prohibited. 
It shall be unlawful to stop, stand or park any motor vehicle which is not properly displaying registration plates or decals properly issued to a person with disabilities in any parking place, including any private or public off-street parking facility, specifically reserved, by the posting of an official sign as designated under 625 ILCS 5/11-301, for motor vehicles displaying such registration plates or decals. It shall be further unlawful to park any motor vehicle in a designated access aisle adjacent to any parking place specifically reserved for persons with disabilities. 
(Code 1964, § 18-134(a); Ord. No. 1979-77, 11-12-1979; Ord. No. 1985-31, 7-8-1985; Ord. No. 2006-16, 2-27-2006; Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(1)(A)), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-709. - Display of decal or other device. 
The official parking decal or device must be displayed either by hanging the decal or device from the rearview mirror or placing it on the dashboard of the vehicle in clear view. Any motor vehicle properly displaying a disability license plate or a parking decal or device containing the international symbol of access issued to persons with disabilities by any local authority, state, district, territory or foreign country shall be recognized by the village as valid and receive the same parking privileges as residents of this state. 
(Code 1964, § 18-134(b); Ord. No. 1979-77, 11-12-1979; Ord. No. 1985-31, 7-8-1985; Ord. No. 2006-16, 2-27-2006; Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(1)(B)), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-710. - Unauthorized use of decal or license plate. 
An individual with a vehicle displaying disability license plates or a parking decal or device issued to a qualified person with a disability under 625 ILCS 5/3-616, 11-1301.1 or 11-1301.2, or to a disabled veteran under 625 ILCS 5/3-609, shall be in further violation of this division if: 
(1)  The person using the disability license plate or parking decal or device is not the authorized holder of the disability license plate or parking decal or device or is not transporting the authorized holder of the disability license plate or parking decal or device to or from the parking location; and 
(2)  The person uses the disability license plate or parking decal or device to exercise any privileges granted through the disability license plate or parking decals or devices under this Code or state law. 
(Code 1964, § 18-134(c); Ord. No. 1979-77, 11-12-1979; Ord. No. 1985-31, 7-8-1985; Ord. No. 2006-16, 2-27-2006; Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(1)(C)), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-711. - Removal of illegally parked vehicle. 
Any person or local authority owning or operating any public or private off-street parking facility may, after notifying the village police department, remove or cause to be removed to the nearest garage or other place of safety any vehicle parked within a stall or space reserved for use by a person with disabilities which does not display person with disabilities registration plates or a special decal or device as required under this division. 
(Code 1964, § 18-134(d); Ord. No. 1979-77, 11-12-1979; Ord. No. 1985-31, 7-8-1985; Ord. No. 2006-16, 2-27-2006; Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(1)(D)), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-712. - Penalties. 
(a)  Any person found liable or guilty of violating the provisions of section 54-708 shall be fined not less than $250.00 or more than $350.00 for each offense, in addition to any costs or charges connected with the removal or storage of any motor vehicle removed and stored pursuant to this section or section 625 ILCS 5/11-1301.3. 
(b)  Any person found liable or guilty of violating the provisions of section 54-710 shall be fined no less than $500.00 for each offense. 
(c)  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, it shall not be a defense to a charge under this division that either the sign posted pursuant to this division or the intended accessible parking place does not comply with the technical requirements of 625 ILCS 5/11-301, department regulations or local ordinance if a reasonable person would be made aware by the sign or notice on or near the parking place that the place is reserved for a person with disabilities. 
(Code 1964, §§ 18-134(e), (f); Ord. No. 1979-77, 11-12-1979; Ord. No. 1985-31, 7-8-1985; Ord. No. 2006-16, 2-27-2006; Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(1)(F)), 11-10-2008)  
Secs. 54-713—54-737. - Reserved.  
Subdivision II. - Permits and Permit Parking 
 
Sec. 54-738. - Definitions. 
The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this subdivision, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
Authorized holder means an individual issued a person-with-disabilities parking permit under this subdivision. 
Competent medical specialist means a person affirming that the applicant for a person-with-disabilities parking permit is a disabled person in accordance with 625 ILCS 5/1-159.1. This person shall be licensed under the Medical Practice Act, 225 ILCS 60, or similar law of another jurisdiction, or a person specified in the Illinois Identification Card Act and the state vehicle code, including a physician assistant who has been delegated the authority to make this determination by his supervising physician, or an advanced practice nurse who has a written collaborative agreement with a collaborating physician that authorizes the advanced practice nurse to make this determination pursuant to 625 ILCS 5/3-616(a). 
False application information means any incorrect or inaccurate information concerning the name, date of birth, social security number, driver's license number, physician certification, or any other information required on the application for a person-with-disabilities parking permit that falsifies the content of the application. 
Fictitious-person-with-disabilities parking permit means any person-with-disabilities parking permit placard that has been issued by the village manager that was issued based upon false information contained on the required application. 
Fraudulent person-with-disabilities parking placard means any person-with-disabilities parking placard that purports to be an official person-with-disabilities parking placard and has not been issued by the village manager. 
Person with disabilities means a natural person who, as determined by a licensed physician, or by a physician's assistant who has been delegated the authority to make this determination by his supervising physician, or an advanced practice nurse who has a written collaborative agreement with a collaborating physician that authorizes the advanced practice nurse to make this determination: 
(1)  Cannot walk 200 feet without stopping to rest; cannot walk without the use of, or assistance from, a brace, cane, crutch, another person, prosthetic device, wheelchair, or other assistive device; 
(2)  Is restricted by lung disease to such an extent that his forced (respiratory) expiratory volume for one second, when measured by spirometry, is less than one liter, or the arterial oxygen tension is less than 60 mmhg on room air at rest; 
(3)  Uses portable oxygen; 
(4)  Has a cardiac condition to the extent that the person's functional limitations are classified in severity as Class III or Class IV according to standards set by the American Heart Association; 
(5)  Is severely limited in the person's ability to walk due to an arthritic, neurological, or orthopedic condition; or 
(6)  Cannot walk 200 feet without stopping to rest because of one of the above five conditions. 
Person-with-disabilities parking permit placard means a card described in this subdivision that, when displayed in a vehicle, authorizes the parking of the vehicle in a parking space specifically reserved for the disabled person. 
Unlawfully altered person-with-disabilities parking permit placard means any persons-with-disabilities parking placard issued by the village manager that has been physically altered or changed in such a manner that false information, which may include, but shall not be limited to, incorrect expiration date or incorrect permit number, appears on the person-with-disabilities parking placard. 
(Code 1964, § 18-134(g); Ord. No. 1979-77, 11-12-1979; Ord. No. 1985-31, 7-8-1985; Ord. No. 2006-16, 2-27-2006; Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(2)(A)), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-739. - Permit applications. 
(a)  A person with a disability that wishes to apply for a person-with-disabilities parking permit must be a resident of the village and shall submit the following to the village manager: 
(1)  A letter addressed to the village manager requesting the issuance of a person-with-disabilities parking permit and the installation of a person-with-disabilities parking permit sign at the address of the residence of the person with disabilities; 
(2)  The person-with-disabilities parking permit fee in the amount provided in the village fee schedule; 
(3)  Proof of residency of the person with disabilities within the corporate limits of the village (i.e., driver's license, utility bill); 
(4)  The current registration card of the vehicle registered in the applicant's name for which the application is being made or if the vehicle for which the application is being made is not registered in the applicant's name, a statement that the person with disabilities does not own a vehicle in his or her own name; 
(5)  The current registration card of the vehicle registered in the name of the person who is the owner of the vehicle upon which the person with disabilities relies for his mode of transportation; 
(6)  The address, phone number, relationship to the disabled person and signature of the person who is the owner of the vehicle upon which the person with disabilities relies for his mode of transportation; and 
(7)  A disability certification completed by a competent medical specialist and the applicant to the effect that such person is a person with disabilities as defined by 625 ILCS 5/1-159.1, unless the person has been issued a disabled veteran or person-with-disabilities license and has a certification form on file or the person has a state disabled person's identification card with a 1A or 2A classification as provided in Section 24 of the Illinois Identification Card Act, then in lieu of a disability certification, a copy of the individual's state identification card, disabled veteran identification card, person-with-disabilities identification card, or state driver's license. In the case of a person with disabilities who is under the age of 18, the identification card number of the minor's parent or legal guardian may be submitted. 
(b)  The disability certification shall contain the following items: 
(1)  An opinion from the competent medical specialist that the person with disabilities falls within the definition of a person with disabilities as outlined in 625 ILCS 5/1-159.1 and provided in this subdivision; 
(2)  An opinion from the competent medical specialist whether the disability is permanent or temporary. If temporary, the competent medical specialist shall also indicate the anticipated duration of the disability (not to exceed six months); 
(3)  The certifying competent medical specialist's name, address, telephone number, professional license number, and signature; 
(4)  The applicant's name, address, telephone number, social security number, and driver's license number or state identification number; 
(5)  The vehicle identification number and license plate number for the vehicle used to transport the person with disabilities; and 
(6)  The name, address, phone number, relationship to the disabled individual, and signature of the person who is the owner of the vehicle upon which the person with disabilities relies for his mode of transportation, and that he does not own a vehicle in his name, if the vehicle is not owned by the applicant having the disability. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(2)(B)), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-740. - Person-with-disabilities parking permit term; renewal. 
Person-with-disabilities parking permits shall be valid from January 1 to December 31 of a calendar year. A person-with-disabilities parking permit may be renewed. A person with a disability that wishes to apply for a renewal of a person-with-disabilities parking permit must submit an application for renewal to the village manager which complies with the requirements of this subdivision. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(2)(C)), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-741. - Approval of a person-with-disabilities parking permit. 
(a)  The village manager shall review all applications and all renewal applications for a person-with-disabilities parking permit. If the application complies with the requirements of this subdivision, the village manager shall issue a person-with-disabilities parking permit placard. The person-with-disabilities parking permit placard shall be issued with a unique permit number. 
(b)  Upon issuance of a person-with-disabilities parking permit placard, the village manager shall direct the division of streets of the department of public works and services to erect one or more signs designating the parking space immediately adjoining the person-with-disabilities' residence as being reserved for the person with disabilities. The signs designating the parking space reserved for the person with disabilities shall bear the number of the person-with-disabilities' parking permit placard. 
(c)  If a person-with-disabilities parking permit placard is lost, destroyed or stolen, a replacement placard may be issued upon an application for replacement to the village manager accompanied by a replacement fee in the amount provided in the village fee schedule. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(2)(D), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-742. - Person-with-disabilities parking permit privileges. 
(a)  Any motor vehicle bearing a person-with-disabilities parking permit placard issued pursuant to this subdivision may park, in addition to any other lawful place, in the parking space specifically reserved for such vehicle by the posting of an official sign as provided in this subdivision. 
(b)  Parking privileges granted under this section are strictly limited to the person to whom the person-with-disabilities parking permit is issued and to qualified operators of the motor vehicle acting under the person-with-disabilities' express direction while the person with disabilities is present. 
(c)  A person to whom person-with-disabilities parking permit privileges are granted shall, at the request of a police officer or any other person invested by law with authority to direct, control or regulate traffic, present an identification card with a photograph as verification that the person is the person to whom the person-with-disabilities parking permit was issued. 
(d)  No person shall use any parking area specifically reserved for parking a motor vehicle assigned a person-with-disabilities parking permit during any time or during any hours during which parking is otherwise prohibited on the street where the parking space is located. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(2)(E)), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-743. - Revocation of permit. 
(a)  Upon receipt of a written complaint that a person-with-disabilities parking permit placard is being used by a non-disabled person, the village manager shall attempt to verify the license plate or permit owner's eligibility for the person-with-disabilities parking permit. 
(b)  In determining eligibility, the village manager shall notify the person-with-disabilities parking permit authorized holder that the complaint has been received regarding the misuse of the person-with-disabilities parking permit placard. The village manager shall also request that the person-with-disabilities parking permit authorized holder submit within 14 days an updated certification by a competent medical specialist that the authorized holder is disabled as defined by 625 ILCS 5/1-159.1 and in this subdivision. 
(c)  If the competent medical specialist chosen by the person-with-disabilities parking permit authorized holder indicates on the certification that the person-with-disabilities parking permit authorized holder does not have a qualifying disability, the person-with-disabilities parking permit shall be revoked in accordance with 625 ILCS 5/3-704(11). 
(d)  If the person-with-disabilities parking permit authorized holder fails to submit a certification from a competent medical specialist within 14 days that indicates that the person-with-disabilities parking permit authorized holder has a qualifying disability, the person-with-disabilities parking permit shall be revoked in accordance with 625 ILCS 5/3-704(11). 
(e)  If the competent medical specialist affirms that the person-with-disabilities parking permit authorized holder has a permanent qualifying disability, no revocation action shall be taken. 
(f)  Any person whose person-with-disabilities parking permit is being considered for revocation in accordance with 625 ILCS 5/3-704(11) may request a hearing to be conducted by the village manager. 
(g)  A person-with-disabilities parking permit shall be revoked if: 
(1)  It is determined to be issued to a person who is not disabled; 
(2)  It is determined that the person-with-disabilities parking permit application contained false application information; or 
(3)  It is determined that the authorized holder of a person-with-disabilities parking permit placard has an unlawfully altered person-with-disabilities parking permit placard. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(2)(F), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-744. - Parking in spaces reserved for persons with disabilities. 
It shall be unlawful to stop, stand or park any motor vehicle which is not properly displaying a persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard properly issued to a person with disabilities in any parking place specifically reserved, by the posting of an official sign as designated under this subdivision, for that particular persons-with-disabilities parking permit. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(3)(A), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-745. - Display of permit; unauthorized use prohibited. 
The persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard must be displayed either by hanging the placard from the rearview mirror or placing it on the dashboard of the vehicle in clear view. A person with a vehicle displaying a persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard issued to a qualified person with a disability shall be in further violation of this section if: 
(1)  The person using the persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard is not the authorized holder of the persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard or is not transporting the authorized holder of the persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard to or from the parking location; and 
(2)  The person uses the persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard to exercise any privileges granted through the persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard under this Code or state law. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(3)(B), (C), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-746. - Other prohibited acts and violations. 
It is a violation of this subdivision for any person to: 
(1)  Knowingly possess any fictitious or unlawfully altered persons-with-disabilities parking permit placard or a fraudulent person-with-disabilities parking placard; 
(2)  Knowingly possess without authority any person-with-disabilities parking-placard-making implement; 
(3)  Knowingly duplicate, manufacture, sell, or transfer any fraudulent or stolen person-with-disabilities parking placard; 
(4)  Knowingly assist in the duplication, manufacturing, selling, or transferring of any fraudulent, stolen, or reported lost or damaged person-with-disabilities parking placard; 
(5)  Advertise or distribute a fraudulent person-with-disabilities parking placard; 
(6)  Knowingly issue or assist in the issuance of, by the village manager, any fictitious person-with-disabilities parking placard; 
(7)  Knowingly alter any person-with-disabilities parking placard; 
(8)  Knowingly manufacture, possess, transfer, or provide any documentation used in the application process, whether real or fictitious, for the purpose of obtaining a fictitious person-with-disabilities parking placard; 
(9)  Knowingly provide any false information to the village manager in order to obtain a person-with-disabilities parking placard; or 
(10)  Knowingly transfer a person-with-disabilities parking placard for the purpose of exercising the privileges granted to an authorized holder of a person-with-disabilities parking placard under this Code in the absence of the authorized holder. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(3)(D), 11-10-2008)  
Sec. 54-747. - Penalties. 
(a)  Any person found liable or guilty of violating the provisions of section 54-744 shall be fined not less than $250.00, nor more than $350.00, for each offense, in addition to any costs or charges connected with the removal or storage of any motor vehicle removed and stored pursuant to this section or 625 ILCS 5/11-1301.3. 
(b)  Any person found liable or guilty of violating the provisions of section 54-745 or 54-746 shall be fined no less than $500.00 for each offense. 
(c)  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, it shall not be a defense to a charge under this section that either the sign posted pursuant to this section or the intended accessible parking place does not comply with the technical requirements of 625 ILCS 5/11-301 department regulations, or local ordinance if a reasonable person would be made aware by the sign or notice on or near the parking place that the place is reserved for a person with disabilities. 
(Ord. No. 2008-87, § 2(18-134(3)(E), 11-10-2008)  
Secs. 54-748—54-777. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 4. - SCHOOL ZONES 
 
Sec. 54-778. - Parking in school zones. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park a vehicle between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. on school days on any street next to a school building or grounds, on the side of the street on which the school is located, which areas are designated and posted as school zones, except: 
(1)  On the west side of Golf Road between Washington Avenue and Rockefeller Avenue, where parking is prohibited between the hours of 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m., Monday through Friday; and 
(2)  On the west side of Maple Avenue from the alley south of Washington Avenue to Lincoln Avenue. 
(Code 1964, § 18-123; Ord. of 9-28-1959; Ord. No. 2018-54 , § 2, 5-14-2018)  
Sec. 54-779. - Discharging and receiving passengers in school zones. 
No person shall stop, stand, or park a motor vehicle and permit a person to enter or exit the motor vehicle on school days during the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. when: 
(1)  The motor vehicle is southbound on Forest Avenue between Shields Avenue and Congress Park Avenue; 
(2)  The motor vehicle is southbound on Raymond Avenue between Shields Avenue and Congress Park Avenue; or 
(3)  The motor vehicle is northbound on Madison Avenue between Shields Avenue and Congress Park Avenue. 
(Code 1964, § 18-112.01; Ord. No. 95-42, 9-25-1995)  
Secs. 54-780—54-796. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 5. - COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL AREAS AND VEHICLES 
 
Sec. 54-797. - Overnight parking in certain commercial and industrial zones. 
(a)  Except as may be otherwise permitted within this section, no person shall park a vehicle on any commercially or industrially zoned street or a street specifically designated by the board of trustees for a period of longer than 30 minutes between the hours of 2:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m. on any day, except that physicians or medical practitioners on emergency calls are exempted. 
(b)  The parking of vehicles on the following specific commercially and industrially zoned street or a street otherwise designated by the board of trustees shall be prohibited between the hours of 2:30 a.m. and 6:00 a.m. on any day: 
(1)  On the south side of Burlington Avenue, beginning at a point 35 feet east of its intersection with Prairie Avenue and continuing easterly to a point 105 feet east therefrom. 
(2)  On both sides of the center median located on Broadway Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Park Avenue and continuing westerly for a distance of 275 feet therefrom. 
(3)  On the east side of Deyo Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Ogden Avenue and continuing northerly to the first alley north thereof. 
(4)  On the north side of Lincoln Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Grand Boulevard and continuing easterly to a point 190 feet east therefrom. 
(5)  On the south side of Lincoln Avenue between Maple Avenue and Madison Avenue. 
(6)  On the northeast side of Grand Boulevard, beginning at its intersection with Lincoln Avenue and continuing southeasterly to a point 200 feet southeast therefrom. 
(7)  On the south side of Lincoln Avenue beginning at its intersection with Grand Boulevard and continuing easterly to a point 200 feet east therefrom. 
(c)  The parking of vehicles on the following specific commercially and industrially zoned street or a street otherwise designated by the board of trustees shall be prohibited between the hours of 2:30 a.m. and 6:00 a.m. on Monday through Friday inclusive, provided that such day is not a legal holiday in the state and between the 3:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. on Saturday, Sunday and legal holidays: 
(1)  On the northeast and southwest sides of Grand Boulevard, beginning at its intersection with Grant Avenue and continuing southeasterly to its intersection with Brookfield Avenue. 
(2)  On the west side of Prairie Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Brookfield Avenue and continuing northeasterly to a point 206 feet northeast therefrom. 
(3)  On the north side of Fairview Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Brookfield Avenue and continuing westerly to a point 107 feet west therefrom. 
(d)  The parking of vehicles on the following specific commercially and industrially zoned street or a street otherwise designated by the board of trustees shall be prohibited between the hours of 4:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m. on any day: 
(1)  On the north side of Brookfield Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Forest Avenue and continuing westerly to its intersection with Prairie Avenue. 
(2)  On the east side of Maple Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Broadway Avenue and continuing northerly to its intersection with Monroe Avenue. 
(3)  On the west side of Arthur Avenue, beginning at its intersection with 47th Street and continuing northerly for a distance of 103 feet therefrom. 
(4)  On the north side of Brookfield Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Woodside Avenue and continuing westerly to its intersection with Hollywood Avenue. 
(5)  On the east side of Sunnyside Avenue, beginning at its intersection with Ogden Avenue and continuing northerly to the intersection of the first alley north thereof. 
(Code 1940, § 35.022; Code 1964, § 18-125; Ord. of 3-8-1954; Ord. of 5-10-1954; Ord. of 9-12-1955, § 1; Ord. No. 90-34, 6-25-1990; Ord. No. 93-17, 5-24-1993; Ord. No. 94-14, 2-28-1994; Ord. No. 2000-60, 10-23-2000; Ord. No. 2007-34, § 2, 4-23-2007; Ord. No. 2010-05, § 2, 1-11-2010)  
Sec. 54-798. - Parking commercial and industrial vehicles in residential areas. 
It shall be unlawful to park vehicles of the second division used for the transportation of persons or properties in the furtherance of any commercial or industrial enterprise which weigh in excess of 4,000 pounds when empty, any place on either the public streets, alleys or on private property in an area zoned for residential purposes, unless the vehicle is parked in a garage, excluding, however buses licensed by the state which carry schoolchildren. 
(Code 1964, § 18-135; Ord. No. 1980-12, 5-27-1980)  
Sec. 54-799. - Truck parking prohibited on certain designated streets. 
It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to park any truck at any time on the east or west sides of Maple Avenue from Jackson Avenue to a point 50 feet south of Monroe Avenue and on the west side of Maple Avenue from Ogden Avenue to Windemere Avenue. 
(Code 1964, § 18-145; Ord. No. 1974-18, § 1, 10-28-1974; Ord. No. 1979-1, § A, 1-8-1979)  
Sec. 54-800. - Parking of certain wide vehicles restricted. 
It shall be unlawful to park any motor vehicles exceeding 86 inches in width, including side view mirrors, if any on public streets except for a period not to exceed two hours for the purpose of loading or unloading such vehicle, except when such vehicle is actually and necessarily being used in connection with the making of a delivery or the performance of a service in the immediate area, in which case it may be parked only as long as it is necessary to complete such delivery or service. 
(Code 1964, § 18-128(a); Ord. No. 78-51, § A, 11-27-1978; Ord. No. 79-55, 9-10-1979; Ord. No. 88-28, 9-26-1988; Ord. No. 90-34, 6-25-1990; Ord. No. 91-25, 7-22-1991; Ord. No. 98-49, 11-9-1998)  
Sec. 54-801. - Vehicles for hire. 
It shall be unlawful to park any for-hire vehicle, limousine, taxicab, towtruck, vehicle transporter or vehicle transporter trailer on any public street or in any public alley, except when such vehicle is actually and necessarily being used in the connection with the making of a delivery or the performance of a service in the immediate area, in which case such vehicle may be parked only as long as it is necessary to complete the delivery or service. 
(Code 1964, § 18-128(d); Ord. No. 78-51, § A, 11-27-1978; Ord. No. 79-55, 9-10-1979; Ord. No. 88-28, 9-26-1988; Ord. No. 90-34, 6-25-1990; Ord. No. 91-25, 7-22-1991; Ord. No. 98-49, 11-9-1998)  
Secs. 54-802—54-825. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 6. - TEMPORARY AND EMERGENCY PARKING RESTRICTIONS 
 
Sec. 54-826. - Parking on block where fire apparatus is stopped. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle, other than one on official business, within any block where fire apparatus has stopped in answer to a fire alarm. 
(Code 1940, § 35.043; Code 1964, § 18-124)  
Sec. 54-827. - Temporary prohibition for street maintenance and snow removal. 
(a)  The village manager is hereby authorized to determine and designate zones in which the parking of vehicles may be prohibited temporarily for the purpose of sweeping or repairing streets or for the purpose of removing snow therefrom. 
(b)  Whenever necessary to prohibit parking for such purposes, the village manager shall designate the areas in which parking shall be so prohibited and the period of time during which parking shall be prohibited and shall place, erect and maintain appropriate signs indicating the same and stating the time during which such parking shall be prohibited. 
(Code 1964, § 18-129; Ord. of 6-24-1957, § 2)  
Sec. 54-828. - Street cleaning and right-of-way maintenance. 
(a)  During the period beginning April 1 through November 30 of each year, it shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation, to stop, stand or park any vehicle along one side of each street in the village between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. on the one day of the week designated by the street signs located on the sides of each street. 
(b)  This regulation applies to all streets in the village and takes precedence over any other parking signs which may be posted. 
(c)  The purpose of this regulation is to allow for expedient street cleaning and right-of-way maintenance. 
(d)  Enforcement shall be excluded on village holidays since work crews do not provide street cleaning and right-of-way maintenance on those days. 
( Ord. No. 2015-61, § 2 , 9-28-2015) 
Editor's note— Ord. No. 2015-61, § 2 , adopted Sept. 28, 2015, amended § 54-828 in its entirety to read as herein set out. Former § 54-828 pertained to street cleaning and leaf removal, and derived from Code 1964, § 18-138; Ord. No. 90-34, adopted June 25, 1990; and Ord. No. 91-25, adopted July 22, 1991.  
Sec. 54-829. - Snow parking. 
(a)  Purpose and applicability. The purpose of this section is to allow for expedient snow control. This section applies to all streets in the village and takes precedence over any other parking signs which may be posted. 
(b)  Parking prohibited during certain times in specific areas. During the period beginning December 1 through March 31 of each year, it shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation, to stop, stand or park any vehicle after two or more inches of snow has fallen in the village as follows: 
(1)  On the north and west sides of any street in the village on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays between 8:00 a.m. and 8:00 p.m. 
(2)  On the south and east sides of any street in the village on Tuesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sunday between 8:00 a.m. and 8:00 p.m. 
(c)  Removal of vehicles authorized. Vehicles not moved in snow emergencies of six inches or more are subject to removal as provided in this division. 
(Code 1964, § 18-144; Ord. No. 1979-72, 10-22-1979; Ord. No. 90-34, 6-25-1990; Ord. No. 91-25, 7-22-1991; Ord. No. 2001-52, 11-12-2001; Ord. No. 2011-50, § 2, 9-12-2011)  
Sec. 54-830. - Parking of vehicles with snow plow blades on public right-of-way. 
It shall be unlawful to park vehicles with attached snow plow blades which exceed the width of the vehicles on which they are attached, as measured from the extremity of the front bumper, on the public right-of-way, or to detach and park snow plow blades on the public right-of-way at any time. 
(Code 1964, § 18-136; Ord. No. 1984-9, 2-13-1984)  
Secs. 54-831—54-853. - Reserved.

(Code 1964, § 18-140; Ord. No. 99-52, 12-13-1999; Ord. No. 2000-60, 10-23-2000; Ord. No. 2008-16, § 2(18-140), 3-10-2008; Ord. No. 2013-57, § 2 , 11-11-2013; Ord. No. 2016-40 , § 2, 8-22-2016)  
Sec. 54-856. - Limited duration parking between 8:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle upon any of the streets listed in this section between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m., except Sundays and holidays, for a period longer than that specified in this section. 
(1)  Fifteen-minute limit. The time limit for parking at the following places shall be 15 minutes: 
a.  On the east side of Prairie Avenue from the alley immediately north of Brookfield Avenue north to a point 100 feet north of such alley. 
b.  On the west side of DuBois Boulevard from 47th Street to the first alley north thereof. 
c.  On the east side of DuBois Avenue from Ogden Avenue to the first alley north thereof. 
(2)  One-hour limit. The time limit for parking at the following places shall be one hour: 
a.  On the north side of Brookfield Avenue from Forest Avenue east to a point of 142.5 feet east of Forest Avenue. 
b.  On the south side of Brookfield Avenue from Prairie Avenue west to a point 130 feet west of Prairie Avenue. 
c.  On the south side of Burlington Avenue from Prairie Avenue east to a point 120 feet east of Prairie Avenue. 
d.  On both sides of Deyo Avenue from Ogden Avenue south to the first alley paralleling Ogden Avenue on the south. 
e.  On the north side of Fairview Avenue from the intersection thereof with Grand Boulevard west to a point 76.35 feet west of such intersection. 
f.  On the east side of Maple Avenue from the alley north of Washington Avenue to Washington Avenue.

Sec. 54-857. - Limited duration parking between 8:00 am and 6:00 p.m. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle upon any of the streets listed in this section between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m., except Saturdays, Sundays and holidays for a period in excess of two hours:

(2)  On the east side of Prairie Avenue from Grant Avenue to a point 100 feet north of the first alley south thereof.

(5)  On the north side of Windemere Avenue from Vernon Avenue to the first alley west of Prairie Avenue. 
(6)  On the north side of Windemere Avenue from Prairie Avenue to Forest Avenue.

(Ord. No. 2018-78 , § 2, 9-10-2018)

DIVISION 8. - RESIDENT ONLY PARKING 
 
Sec. 54-882. - Neighborhood resident parking only; registration. 
(a)  No person shall park any vehicle at any time in those areas designated for resident parking only, except persons who are actual residents of the area so designated, or their authorized guests having a vehicle identification tag or guest pass affixed to or displayed upon the vehicle so parked. 
(b)  Upon the payment of a registration fee in the amount provided in the village fee schedule, any village resident residing in the designated area desiring to utilize the designated area for parking shall receive from the village manager the requisite vehicle identification tag and guest passes. The vehicle identification tag shall be affixed to the rear window of the motor vehicle on the driver's side and the guest pass should also be displayed in the same manner. 
(Code 1940, § 35.036; Code 1964, § 18-98(10); Ord. No. 1978-30, § A, 8-14-1978; Ord. No. 1978-36, § A, 8-28-1978; Ord. No. 1979-76, 11-12-1979)  
Sec. 54-883. - Specific designated areas. 
It shall be unlawful for any person to park any vehicle in the following locations, except those vehicles displaying current village vehicle licenses: 
(1)  On both sides of the 3100 block of Oak Avenue. 
(2)  On the north side of Monroe Avenue from Oak Avenue to a point 145 feet west thereof. 
(3)  On the east and west side of the 4100 block of Vernon Avenue from the alley south to 4137 Vernon Avenue. 
(4)  On the east and west side of the 4100 block of Madison Avenue from the alley south to Rochester. 
(5)  On the south side of Congress Park Avenue west of Prairie Avenue. 
(Code 1964, § 18-146; Ord. No. 1977-8, § 1, 3-14-1977; Ord. No. 92-44, 12-14-1992; Ord. No. 2001-61, 12-10-2001; Ord. No. 2002-03, 1-28-2002; Ord. No. 2009-42, § 3, 7-27-2009)  
Secs. 54-884—54-914. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 9. - "B RESIDENT ONLY" DECAL PARKING 
 
Sec. 54-915. - Designation. 
The village may designate any street, right-of-way, lot or space as being limited to the use of those vehicles displaying "B Resident Only" decals. Any vehicle not displaying a proper and current permit or other authorization issued by the village shall be deemed in violation of the requirements of this division. 
(Code 1964, § 18-146.02; Ord. No. 90-50, 12-10-1990)  
Sec. 54-916. - Acquisition of decals. 
The acquisition of a "B Resident Only" parking permit shall be acquired on or before March 15th of the current year or within ten days after the purchase or lawful acquisition of any motor vehicle if the same is purchased or lawfully acquired following March 15 or within 30 days after establishing residence within the village. 
(Code 1964, § 18-146.03; Ord. No. 90-50, 12-10-1990)  
Sec. 54-917. - Available to village residents only; effect of change of residency. 
(a)  Only residents of the village shall be entitled to apply for permanent "B Resident Only" parking permits. Applications for such permanent permits shall be processed only for those vehicles registered to an address upon the block on which the parking is so limited. 
(b)  Abandonment of residency from a block requiring such a parking permit shall automatically rescind any rights of the holder to park within such designated areas requiring such permit during the times which permits are required to be displayed by this division. 
(Code 1964, § 18-146.04; Ord. No. 90-50, 12-10-1990)  
Sec. 54-918. - Placement of decal. 
Upon the issuance of a permanent parking permit under this division for a motor vehicle, the village manager shall deliver to the qualified applicant for such permit a transparent sticker permit decal, which shall bear the words "Resident Parking," the letter designation "B", and the expiration date through which the permit is valid. When such decal is delivered to the applicant, it shall be the applicant's duty to affix the same in the lower left-hand corner of the rear windshield, behind the driver, approximately one-half inch from the lower section of the window frame. 
(Code 1964, § 18-146.05(a); Ord. No. 90-50, 12-10-1990)  
Sec. 54-919. - Tampering with decal prohibited. 
Any person who shall take, destroy, obliterate or remove any such permit decal, without the consent of the owner of the vehicle or the village, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and every such wrongful destruction, obliteration or removal of such permit decal from or upon any vehicle shall be considered a separate offense. 
(Code 1964, § 18-146.05(b); Ord. No. 90-50, 12-10-1990)

DIVISION 10. - PARKING DEVICE FEE ZONES 
 
Sec. 54-944. - Designation. 
(a)  The installation of parking fee devices as an aid in the regulation of vehicular parking upon those streets of the village where parking is restricted under the authority of this chapter is hereby authorized and approved, the actual locations within the restricted parking zone to be designated and named by the police chief and such designation to be evidenced by the physical presence of such fee device thereon. 
(b)  On such named streets and locations, vehicular parking shall continue to be regulated as otherwise provided in this division, but as an aid in the regulation of vehicular parking upon such streets and parking lots, the additional regulations and restrictions of this division shall be obeyed as long as the parking fee devices installed as approved herein remain in place thereon. 
(c)  Parking device fee zones established shall be intended to provide parking aid and control upon Burlington Avenue, Brookfield Avenue and off-street parking lots owned or leased by the village and such other locations as may be designated by the village board from time to time. 
(Code 1964, § 18-137.02; Ord. No. 1986-6, 1-27-1986; Ord. No. 95-46, 10-9-1995)
